PC78:
Under the proposed zone – Plan Change 78, the property has a zoning of Residential – Mixed Housing Suburban.  This zone is to be the most widespread residential zone in Auckland.  Its density controls allow a moderate level of intensification, while retaining a relatively spacious quality consistent with a suburban residential character, compared to the Mixed Housing Urban and Terrace Housing and Apartment Buildings zones.  
Subdivision and development within the zone allows two dwellings per site as a permitted activity and three or more dwellings being a restricted discretionary activity.  Further, development of two dwellings will need to comply with the following standards within the Mixed Housing Suburban zone:
Building Height
Height in relation to boundary
Minimum yard depth setbacks from each boundary
Maximum impervious area
Building coverage
Landscaped area
Outlook space
Daylight ingress
Outdoor living space
Fencing and wall restrictions
Subdivision for three or more dwellings within this zone, while being restricted discretionary will also need to comply with the following standards within the zone, building height; height in relation to boundary and minimum yard depth setbacks from each boundary. 
Vacant proposed site subdivision is a restricted discretionary activity within this zone and allows a net site area of 400 sm for parent sites that are less than one hectare.  For parent sites that are in excess of one hectare, vacant proposed site subdivision is a discretionary activity with the following rules regarding site areas:
Minimum net site area	320 sm
Minimum average net site area	400 sm
Maximum average net site area	480 sm
The Mixed Housing Suburban zone aims to enable a variety of housing types and encourage development as it is the most wide-spread residential zone under the unitary plan.  The zone is concentrated around residential use but allows for non – residential activities that will support the social and economic well-being of the community while monitoring any effects on the residential amenity of the zone.

The eastern boundary extends approximately 28.9 metres, and the southwestern boundary measures roughly 40 metres. Contourwise, the site is generally level.

"Freehold - Townhouse:  As shown above, the subject Lot 7 comprises a rectangular-shaped site of approximately 59 sm, with an average width of 4.05 metres and a depth of about 14.66 metres. It is positioned within a relatively large townhouse development comprising 63 lots.
The lot includes a designated car park marked “FE” and is associated with Lot 100 (3,168 sm), which provides vehicular and pedestrian access from Great North Road. The ownership includes a 1/62 share in Lot 100."

"Freehold - Townhouse 2: As shown above, the subject Lot 2 is positioned within a four-lot development, occupying the northern corner of the site with frontage to East Coast Road. The site is near-rectangular in shape, comprising approximately 166 sm, with a frontage to East Coast Road of around 14.97 metres and a depth along the north-eastern boundary of approximately 10.31 metres. In addition, the subject lot has a direct pedestrian access off East Coast Road.
The lot is associated with Lot 100 (78 sm), which provides shared vehicular and pedestrian access from Maxwelton Drive. Lot 100 is held in equal shares by the owners of Lots 1–4. 
In terms of contour, the development is level throughout, sitting slightly below the road level of East Coast Road. The site is also subject to various proposed rights of way and easements relating primarily to use of the jointly owned access lot and shared services easements, which are set down as follows:"

"Cross Lease:  As shown above, the subject property, Flat 2, is positioned at the rear of a cross-lease site with a total area of approximately 1,214 sm. Access to the property is via a shared driveway, marked as “Common Area,” measuring some 35 metres from the street frontage. The subject property occupies the exclusive land use area “C,” with an estimated site area of approximately 530 sm. The site has an eastern boundary / width of approximately 16.4 metres and an average depth of around 32 metres, with the dwelling positioned towards the front of the site.
Contourwise, the site falls steeply towards the rear."

"Unit Title : As shown above, the subject unit occupies an eastern end position within the building block and benefits from having the largest courtyard area in the development. Contour-wise, the development moderately rises in an east-to-west direction."

ConclusionOnSalesEvidence:
"GENERAL FREEHOLD : The subject property comprises a freestanding dwelling originally constructed circa 1980s, now presented in modest to average condition with dated fitout, and would benefit from modernisation/renovation. The dwelling provides three bedrooms and one bathroom, together with a detached double garage.
In a broader context, comparable properties with similar characteristics have transacted in the range of $670,000 to $835,000 between October 2024 and June 2025, with an average sale price of approximately $771,000. These properties provide floor areas between 80 sm and 140 sm (averaging 123 sm) and are situated on sites ranging from 363 sm to 922 sm, with an average site size of 617 sm.
On balance, and taking into account the physical attributes of the property including its age, size, condition, views, and aspect, together with also allowing for the prevailing market conditions, we believe the subject property would warrant a market value ranging between $740,000 – $780,000, and we deem it appropriate in this instance to adopt the mid-point of this range at a figure of $760,000."

"SMALL FREEHOLD LAND / CROSS LEASE: Given that the subject property comprises a standalone dwelling situated on a freehold site (with an approximate usable land area of 345 sm), we have considered comparable properties of a similar nature, including properties of freehold and cross lease tenure, with focus on those with freehold tenure.
In a broader sense, the surrounding properties having similar features have sold in the range of $855,000 to $1,050,000 between October 2024 and July 2025, with an average sale price of $957,000. These properties have floor areas ranging from 92 sm to 180 sm, with an average of 120 sm – which is comparable to the subject property.
On balance, and taking into account the physical attributes of the property including its age, size, condition, views, and aspect, together with also allowing for the prevailing market conditions, we believe the subject property would warrant a market value ranging between $975,000 – $1,025,000, and we deem it appropriate in this instance to adopt the mid-point of this range at a figure of $1,000,000."

"FREEHOLD TOWNHOUSE: In assessing the market value of the subject property, we have considered dwellings that sold and under contract within the subject development together with recently completed townhouse developments in the surrounding area, with emphasis on properties of comparable location, age, building size, and land area.
The comparable townhouses analysed range in size from 136 sm - 164 sm, with an average of approximately 146 sm, which is broadly in line with the subject. Site sizes range from 165 sm - 216 sm, with an average of around 177 sm. The analysed land and building rates vary from approximately $8,540 psm - $9,560 psm, with an average of about $8,890 psm. Generally, the lower end of this range reflects larger townhouse units, while the higher end relates to smaller dwellings.
Of particular note, within the subject development the remaining three lots are either sold or currently under contract. Lot A and Lot C, which have identical configurations, floor areas, and similar land sizes, both occupy road-front positions. These have transacted or are under contract between May 2025 and the present at prices ranging from $1,255,000 - $1,300,000, reflecting analysed land and building rates of $8,840 psm - $9,570 psm.
On balance, and taking into account the physical attributes of the property including its age, size, condition, views, and aspect, together with also allowing for the prevailing market conditions, we believe the subject property would warrant a market value ranging between $1,250,000 – $1,290,000, and we deem it appropriate in this instance to adopt the mid-point of this range at a figure of $1,270,000, which reflects a land and building rate of approximately $8,950 psm, comfortably within the evidence range outlined above."

"FREEHOLD NEW DEVELOPMENT AREA: In assessing the market value of the subject property, we have considered a range of comparable dwellings of similar building and land size within this recently established development area, with transactions recorded between July 2025 - August 2025. The analysed dwellings have floor areas ranging from 80 sm - 97 sm, with an average of 86 sm, which is broadly consistent with the subject property. Site areas range from 178 sm - 235 sm, averaging approximately 195 sm. Sale prices for these properties ranged between $712,000 - $835,000, with an average of approximately $789,000 prior to any adjustments.
Of particular note, the most comparable sales were achieved between $795,000 - $805,000 for properties located on the same road as the subject. The strongest evidence is 24 Kotiu Place, which adjoins the subject property and has identical dwelling and land sizes. It is also noted that there is strong competition among developments in the surrounding area, with a growing number of similar projects placing some competitive pressure on values.
On balance, and taking into account the subject property’s physical attributes including its age, size, condition, outlook, and position, together with prevailing market conditions, we are of the opinion that the subject property would warrant a market value in the range of $775,000 - $800,000. For reporting purposes, we have adopted the midpoint of this range at $785,000, reflecting current market evidence."

"UNIT TITLE : In assessing the market value of the subject property, we have considered units that sold within the subject development together with comprable units in the surrounding area, with emphasis on properties of comparable location, age, building size, and land area.
In a broader market context, comparable properties with similar characteristics have transacted between $726,000 – $835,000 over the period October 2024 to July 2025, at an average sale price of approximately $777,000. These comparables provide floor areas ranging from 63 sm to 106 sm, with an average of 81 sm.
Of particular note, two units within the subject development have recently sold. Lot 1, an end-positioned unit, sold in July 2025 for $775,000, while Lot 2, a middle unit with a smaller yard, sold in May 2025 for $726,000. These sales reflect analysed land and building rates of approximately $11,524 psm to $12,302 psm. Both units are considered inferior to the subject due to smaller yards and less favourable outlooks.
On balance, and taking into account the physical attributes of the property including its age, size, condition, views, and aspect, together with also allowing for the prevailing market conditions, we believe the subject property would warrant a market value ranging between $800,000 – $840,000, and we deem it appropriate in this instance to adopt the mid-point of this range at a figure of $820,000."
